reblog.content:
Don't listen to anyone who says "likes don't matter" on here.

Yes, it's true that there's no algorithm for them to feed.

But letting people you know that you like what they're sharing, that you agree with them, that they're not just shouting into an empty abyss? That matters.

account.note:
Art major turned law professor. Teaching #Patents, #DesignLaw & #CivPro at #SuffolkLaw.

Researching & writing about #DesignPatents. Currently thinking a lot about the #ScheduleA phenomenon.

Trying to make #PatentFedi happen.

Coauthor of Patent Law: An Open-Access Casebook https://patentlawcasebook.com/

When I'm not thinking about law, I'm usually studying languages (#espaÃ±ol, #franÃ§ais & #svenska), reading novels, or watching Netflix.

#tfr

media_attachments.description:
Two panel meme with title "I have two modes"
First panel, a black cat is in front of a laptop, it looks like the cat is using the laptop. The cat is looking at the camera with a demented expression, wide eyes, wide open mouth. The caption in all caps rainbow coloured letters reads: I CRAVE KNOWLEDGE. 
Second panel: a chonky white and ginger cat is lying on its side. The cat's eyes have been photoshopped to make it look like it has been crying. This cat is the embodiment of despair. The captionreads "i forgor" (weird spelling of the word "forgot" on purpose)

reblog.content:
I think Iâ€™m going to start a new drinking game with @svgeesus : Pick one of the myriad of posts/articles about CSS & color spaces and read it together.

Whoever spots a mistake first must drink a shot of tequila.

Guaranteed state of inebriation for both by the end of the article!

account.note: W3C TAG member, HCI researcher at MIT, CSS WG Invited Expert, CSS Secrets book author. Made PrismJS, Mavo, Color.js, Awesomplete, Bliss, and many other open-source libraries. Shy extrovert.â€¨I â™¥ standards, code, design, UX, food, life!

reblog.content:
#CSS Colour.

1990â€™s - 2010: pick a colour. Use hex. Done!

2010 - 2023: oh, you can have alpha too. Use rgba. *sighs* ok, or hsl you art nerd.

2023: buckle up fuck-nut, do you even know what a colour model is? Well then how can you pick the right one for your design requirement then? Whatâ€™s your gamut? Idiot! Do you even HDR? â€œGreen please?â€ Simpleton. Get out.

account.note:
Middle aged white guy trying to become less ignorant over time.

Iâ€™ve been building websites for ~20yrs. Progressive Enhancement, HTML/CSS/JS, and accessible practices will always be core to quality work. Frameworks come and go.

reblog.content:
Working on a website for a client. Currently there are two types of motion: a scrolling star field and a floating astronaut.

For reduced motion I stopped the star field from scrolling.

My question is: should I also stop the motion of the floating astronaut?

You can view the page here: https://moiety.studio/code/stratospheric-research/
